Legal_Issue: Bias, reasonableness, credibility assessment, state protection
Basis_of_Claim: Persecution based on Roma ethnicity in Hungary
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Credibility, availability of state protection, distinction between discrimination and persecution
Proceeding_Type: Refugee claim and subsequent judicial review
Regulation_Cited: IRPA, sections related to refugee definition and eligibility
Review_Outcome: No basis to overturn IRB decision
Assessment_Standard: Reasonable apprehension of bias, standard of reasonableness
Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board, Federal Court
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA, Article 15(A)-(C) of the Refugee Convention
Cause_of_Refusal: Lack of credibility, no persecution established, state protection available
Evidentiary_Issues: Credibility concerns, insufficient evidence of persecution
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Alleged IRB bias and unreasonable findings
Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, Refugee Convention
Procedural_Issue: Judicial review process, adequacy of reasons
